xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #phenotips on 21 May 2014
xwikidoc.content: <sdumitriu1> has quit 05:22 <sdumitriu1> has joined #phenotips 10:16 <akats> has joined #phenotips 10:18 <akats> What if besides or instead of splitting different categories of phenotypes into their own columns we also split the document into sheets based on phenotype category? 10:26 <sdumitriu1> Too much 10:27 <sdumitriu1> All the data should be in view 10:33 <akats> ok 13:33 <akats> sdumitriu: Would we ever user sheets? Would we ever use formulas? And is .xlsx much more popular than .ods in our audience? 13:34 <sdumitriu> We might use sheets, but much later when we have support for cohorts 13:34 <sdumitriu> I doubt we'll use formulas 13:35 <sdumitriu> Hm, although we might for measurements, but that's a long way off, so no formulas for the foreseeable future 13:35 <sdumitriu> Yes, xlsx is more popular as of now 13:35 <akats> What are cohorts? 13:35 <sdumitriu> Families 14:16 <sdumitriu> has quit 14:21 <sdumitriu> has joined #phenotips 15:05 <vijay13> has quit 15:35 <akats> If I change a value of a mockito spy, does it change the value of the underlying object? 16:36 <allasm> has quit 16:37 <mcupak> has quit 17:18 <akats> has quit 18:12 <vijay13> has quit 23:11 <vijay13> has quit
